sentences: Christopher "Cris" Kirkwood (born October 22, 1960) is an American musician who is the bassist and a founding member of the Meat Puppets, an alternative punk rock band.
In 1980 the brothers and their friend Derrick Bostrom, a drummer, decided to form a band, which they eventually named the Meat Puppets.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Besides playing bass Kirkwood's role in the band grew over the years to include singing and songwriting.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Kirkwood's use of drugs began to spin out of control after the success of 1994's Too High to Die, and he developed a severe heroin addiction.

sentences: Tardif eventually died of a drug overdose in August 1998.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: in 1995, Kirkwood's compulsive behavior during what was already a stressful time for the band led to the Meat Puppets entering a period of inactivity.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Despite numerous interventions and rehab stays, Kirkwood remained addicted to narcotics for many years.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In December 2003, Kirkwood got into an argument with a woman over a parking space at a post office in downtown Phoenix.
section: == Biography == | === Imprisonment ===

sentences: In August 2004, Kirkwood pleaded guilty to assault with a deadly weapon and was sentenced to 21 months in prison.
section: == Biography == | === Imprisonment ===

sentences: In August 2004, Kirkwood pleaded guilty to assault with a deadly weapon and was sentenced to 21 months in prison.

sentences: He served out his time and was released on July 7, 2005.

sentences: In April 2006, Billboard announced that Cris and Curt Kirkwood would be recording again as the Meat Puppets.

sentences: "I haven't seen my brother since like 1998, but I'm talking to him a lot," Curt was quoted as saying.
